title.value: Explainable machine learning model to predict COVID-19 severity among older adults in the province of Quebec
title.justification: This is the title of the research paper provided by the user.
title.quote:
Title
Explainable machine learning model to predict COVID-19 severity among older adults in the province of Quebec

extractions.description: This paper evaluates the feasibility of developing explainable machine learning models for predicting the severity of COVID-19 among older adults, particularly in long-term care facilities within Quebec.

type.justification: The paper involves quantitative machine learning methods and experiments to evaluate the feasibility and performance of explainable ML models.
type.quote: In this study, we aimed to evaluate the feasibility of the development of explainable machine learning models to predict COVID-19 severity among older adults.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on developing and evaluating machine learning models.
name.quote: We used XAI-specific methods (e.g., EBM), machine learning methods (i.e., random forest, deep forest, and XGBoost)...

name.justification: The paper focuses heavily on the explainability of the AI models used to predict COVID-19 severity.
name.quote: The lack of explainability—defined as 'the ability to understand and evaluate the internal mechanism of the algorithm/computational process in human terms'—of AI is one of the major challenges to its application in health care.

name.justification: The application domain of the research is healthcare, specifically predicting COVID-19 severity in older adults.
name.quote: Artificial Intelligence (AI) can help with this regard. However, the lack of explainability ... of AI is one of the major challenges to its application in health care.

name.justification: Deep Forest is mentioned as one of the machine learning models used in the study.
name.quote: We used XAI-specific methods (e.g., EBM), machine learning methods (i.e., random forest, deep forest, and XGBoost)...

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not claim that Deep Forest is a novel contribution of this work.
is_contributed.quote: We used XAI-specific methods (e.g., EBM), machine learning methods (i.e., random forest, deep forest, and XGBoost)...

is_executed.justification: The Deep Forest model was executed as part of the experiments to evaluate performance in predicting COVID-19 severity.
is_executed.quote: The best-performing models (and their performance) were as follows. Deep forest using XAI agnostic methods LIME (97.36% AUC, 91.65 ACC), Anchor (97.36% AUC, 91.65 ACC), and PIMP (96.93% AUC, 91.65 ACC).

is_compared.justification: The Deep Forest model is compared against other models in terms of performance metrics like AUC and accuracy.
is_compared.quote: The best-performing models (and their performance) were as follows. Deep forest using XAI agnostic methods LIME (97.36% AUC, 91.65 ACC), Anchor (97.36% AUC, 91.65 ACC), and PIMP (96.93% AUC, 91.65 ACC).

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper title provided for the Deep Forest model.
